# Draft:Tharri Rebellion

The Tharri Rebellion was a Rebellion Carried by The Soomra dynasty in 1030, After The Ghaznavid Sack of Brahmanabad, Soomra Chiefs Collected At Badin and rebelled Against Muhammad of Ghazni.
Background
After the Ghaznavid Sack of Brahmanabad, The Soomra Elders Gathered At Tharri and chosen Soomar as their new Sultan.  Soomar Rebelleled Against Muhammad of Ghazni.
The Rebellion
Soomar Took his Army Consisting of Soomra Tribesman from Tharri, He Retook Brahmanabad Firstly, then he Marched as Far as Multan, which he made into a Tributary under his son Rajbal Ibn Soomar.
Aftermath
The Soomras of Sindh got completely Independent, and the Ghaznavid authority of Sindh was lost, Multan was made a Vassal of Soomar under his son Shaykh Rajbal ibn Soomar.
